alert.note: Alert for Bath; Fleming; Menifee; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 3:55PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Bath, northwestern Menifee, southern Fleming and west central Rowan Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 354 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Marshall, or near Owingsville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Polksville around 400 PM EDT. Moore`s Ferry around 405 PM EDT. Olympia Springs and Ramey around 410 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Salt Lick, Midland, Young Springs, Sudith, Farmers and Freestone. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 116 and 135. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
